snippet: They agreed to a federal model with eight provinces that would allow them to form a government and rebuild the quake-ravaged nation.
abstract: Nepal's four largest political parties, prompted by urgent need to rebuild country after earthquake, set aside differences to form federal government; compromise has not yet addressed all important issues and smaller parties are opposed.

byline.original: By BHADRA SHARMA and ELLEN BARRY

lead_paragraph: They agreed to a federal model with eight provinces that would allow them to form a government and rebuild the quake-ravaged nation.

headline.main: Earthquake Prods Nepal Parties to Make Constitution Deal
headline.print_headline: Quake Prods Nepal Parties to Make Constitution Deal
